entry.title: Can You Dig It?! - Episode 2: 18-01-2024
entry.summary: This episode's guest is Waiheke home garderner Holly Brown. She is growing incredible vegetable crops and flowers. Check out her Instagram account for beautiful photos of her garden and produce - [https://www.instagram.com/hollyamberbrown/](https://www.instagram.com/hollyamberbrown/) ![HB1](//images.ctfassets.net/muwn01agnrp5/3giJPeyGmM888SAvcyYS4l/f8236218638d32991420589ef0805d85/HB1.jpg)![HB2](//images.ctfassets.net/muwn01agnrp5/69SIlAPxYecp0InPZUupp7/554acb8919ca0c5289e786d5680a9e07/HB2.jpg)

entry.title: WaiTalks 2023: Lucy Grace
entry.summary:
Lucy Grace was a guest speaker at WaiTalks 2023. An fundraising event for Talking Tree Hill and Nature2classroom’s research, programmes and well being days for the children and teachers of our Motu. The event was held at Morra Hall, Oneroa on 2nd Dec 2023. https://www.wai-talks.com/
Lucy's talk is preceded by her sharing a poem.
Lucy Grace is an internationally renowned Spiritual Teacher, Holistic Therapist and Poet. She has lived many lives – including as a television journalist for One News and a humanitarian aid worker based in Europe for 15 years working for the UN, Save the Children, Fairtrade and Oxfam. She worked in orphanages and disaster zones around the world helping to bring relief to peoples suffering before settling on Waiheke Island to have her daughter ten years ago.
Lucy now focuses on her work as a Spiritual Teacher, Holistic Therapist and Poet. She is internationally renowned and teaches hundreds of people from around the globe each week in community and group sessions, helping them to connect with their deepest heart, truth and joy.
She holds private sessions with people from around the world seven days a week – there is an 8 month wait-list for these sessions. She is set to run two retreats in the USA and one in Sweeden in 2024.
Lucy was handpicked by an international panel to attend Ghandi 3.0 in India in January 2024 – along with 40 other leaders from around the world in business and spirituality. The event has been honoured by folks ranging from the Dalai Lama to President Obama and brings together change-makers from around the globe to tackle personal, interpersonal and system disconnections of our times by seeding new patterns for a more compassionate society.
Lucy is the author of 'This Untameable Light' released in November 2023 to critical acclaim from some of the most well-known spiritual teachers around the world.

entry.title: WaiTalks 2023: Jade Gray
entry.summary:
Jade Gray was a guest speaker at WaiTalks 2023. An fundraising event for Talking Tree Hill and Nature2classroom’s research, programmes and well being days for the children and teachers of our Motu. The event was held at Morra Hall, Oneroa on 2nd Dec 2023. https://www.wai-talks.com/
Jade Gray left New Zealand for China in 1996 with a smattering of Mandarin and a dream to make it in the worlds fastest growing economy. In a corporate career ranging from managing cattle breeding farms in the North East to supermarket retail in the South West, he gained unique insights into how to succeed and fail in China’s dynamic marketplace.
In 2000 he stepped out on his own and set off on an entrepreneurial journey that cumulated in the Restaurant Group Gung Ho! Ventures, owning several Award Winning Food and Beverage brands including the Gung Ho! Pizza and Pyro Pizza chains, later selling the group in 2019. He has since launched Off-Piste Provisions a food-technology company that develops and manufactures fortified plant-based meat products for nutritious eating on the go.
His professional passion lies in Social Entrepreneurship, speaking at numerous conferences on the issue, including at Tsinghua, Peking and Auckland Universities.
He has served as a New Zealand Trade and Enterprise (NZTE) Beachheads advisor, is a member of the KEA World Class New Zealand network and has a Bachelor of Commerce (Marketing/Chinese) from the University of Otago.

entry.title: WaiTalks2023: Mark Lapwood
entry.summary:
Mark Lapwood was a guest speaker at WaiTalks 2023. An fundraising event for Talking Tree Hill and Nature2classroom’s research, programmes and well being days for the children and teachers of our Motu. The event was held at Morra Hall, Oneroa on 2nd Dec 2023. https://www.wai-talks.com/
Mark Lapwood, an acclaimed cinematographer with over 25 years of professional experience, has made his mark in the world of documentaries, television commercials, music videos, and feature films.
He earned prestigious accreditation with the Australian Cinematographers Society in 2006 and the New Zealand Cinematographers Society in 2021. His work displays mastery in lighting design and camera operation when filming in the studio and on locations around the world.
Mark's work revolves around crafting compelling visual narratives, skilfully weaving together sequences that convey powerful storytelling. He is passionate about human rights, and has turned his camera on important causes in recent years to tell grass roots stories of authentic people standing up for important causes in the face of adversity.
Industry giants such as Netflix, National Geographic, Discovery, BBC, UK Channel 4, SBS, and the NZ Film Commission have entrusted Mark with their feature and series projects.
Mark is based in Auckland, New Zealand and works worldwide.

entry.title: WaiTalks 2023: Michelle Hooper
entry.summary:
Michelle Hooper was a guest speaker at WaiTalks 2023. An fundraising event for Talking Tree Hill and Nature2classroom’s research, programmes and well being days for the children and teachers of our Motu. The event was held at Morra Hall, Oneroa on 2nd Dec 2023. https://www.wai-talks.com/
Michelle has a career spanning 25 years in the major international sporting events industry. Which has included delivering events for World Rugby, FIFA, the International Triathlon Union (ITU), the America’s Cup and leading Olympic Games teams.
She led the implementation of the 2021 Women’s Rugby World Cup occurring in 2022, as Tournament Director. This tournament has been regarded as one of the most successful women’s sporting events in history, setting precedent for future women’s tournaments.
She served as the Team Services Lead during the 2019 Rugby World Cup in Japan and RWC 2011 in New Zealand and as the Competition Director of both the 2015 FIFA Under-20 World Cup and the ITU Triathlon World Series in 2013.
Living on Waiheke Island with her husband and three children is Michelle’s dream come true. Days are now spent building her online business, Sprintify, rapid goal attainment training platform, supporting her family in their pursuits and enjoying the peace of the bush and the birds, represents coming home to her soul.

entry.title: The Boy Who Ate Bugs
entry.summary: The Boy Who Ate Bugs was written and narrated by Waiheke writer Avi Duckor-Jones and was recorded and produced by Brent Simpson.

entry.title: Can You Dig It?! Episode 1: 11 Jan 2024
entry.summary: Chris Walker talks with Eddie Welsh, who sells vege seedlings each Saturday at Ostand market, about what to plant in your home garden.

entry.title: Interview with Susi Newborn Sept 2023
entry.summary: Interview with Susi Newborn from 22nd of September 2023 where she talks about being a protector, family, the history behind the rainbow warrior. It was such a honour to have Susi in Studio for this interview, she will be fondly remembered and missed by everyone whose life she touched.

entry.title: Susi Newborn: Housing
entry.summary: Susi Newborn was a self proclaimed "lunatic and activist". She spent every moment of her life fighting to make the world a better place, with an unwavering commitment to addressing social justice and environmental issues locally and internationally. She sadly passed away on 31 Jan, 2023. Here she speaks with Greg Treadwell in 2017 about island housing Photo credit: Diana Worth/STUFF

entry.title: Susi Newborn: The Environment
entry.summary: Susi Newborn was a self proclaimed "lunatic and activist". She spent every moment of her life fighting to make the world a better place, with an unwavering commitment to addressing social justice and environmental issues locally and internationally. She sadly passed away on 31 Jan, 2023. Here she speaks at a 2015 Waitalks event about one of her great passions - the environment. Photo credit: ABIGAIL DOUGHERTY/STUFF

entry.title: Mana Mixtape interview with Teyo
entry.summary: Koro talks to Italian rapper Teyo

entry.title: Te Korowai o Waiheke rat trial update
entry.summary: Greg Treadwell talks to Owain Tanner from Te Korowai o Waiheke to get an update on the Oneroa rat eradication trial

entry.title: The Wayup Interview: Bob Hewitt
entry.summary: Wayan and Jahn talk to New Yorker Bob Hewitt who has recently moved to Waiheke. They talk about the two books he's written about AI, his love of board games and the after school programme he set up in Brooklyn. They also talk about his plans for life on Waiheke Island.

entry.title: Councillor Mike Lee
entry.summary: Chris Walker talks to councillor Mike Lee about the year since his re-election to Auckland Council and his decision to vote against the introduction of Māori wards. Photo credit: NZ Herald

entry.title: Crop Swap
entry.summary: Chris Walker talks to Hadas Ore about Waiheke Crop Swap. Home gardeners come together to swap their excess produce and share gardening tips.

entry.title: Caulerpa Rahui
entry.summary: Chris Walker talks to Blair Anderson, Pou Rahui Project Manager for Ngāti Pāoa, about the rahui placed by the iwi to prevent the spread of the invasive Caulerpa seaweed.

entry.title: Darleen Tana Elected To Parliament
entry.summary: Chris Walker talks to Darleen Tana whio has just been elected to parliament as a Green list MP

entry.title: Librarian Fiona Kralicek Resigning
entry.summary: Chris Walker talks to Fiona Kralicek who has been the head librarian at Waiheke Community Library for 28 years.

entry.title: Emily King: The Wayup Interview
entry.summary: Wayan and Jahn from the Wayup show interview Emily King a local Surfdale resident about her latest book "Re-food" about New Zealands troubled food networks. The interview covers some of the challenges we face as a nation and how we can tackle them. Read more about Emily https://www.spira.nz/about

entry.title: Maia Piata Rose Week on the Maramataka
entry.summary: Koro talks to Maia Piata Rose Week about the Maramataka. Follow Maia on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/maia_moomies/

entry.title: The Great Waiheke Radio Auckland Central Electorate Candidates Debate
entry.summary: The Great Waiheke Radio Auckland Central Electorate Candidates Debate. Held at Artworks Theatre on Thurs 28 September, 2023. The candidates were Mahesh Muralidhar (National), Oscar Sims (Labour) and Chloe Swarbrick (Green). Facilitated by Chris Walker.

entry.title: Damian Sycamore (TOP) candidate interview
entry.summary: Damian Sycamore is a Waiheke Islander. He is standing for The Opportunities Party (TOP) in the Auckland Central electorate. He spoke to Chris Walker about how TOP policies would address local Waiheke issues.
